div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1773 Tell Kotchek, frontier station be- tween Syria and Iraq, c. 80 km. SW of anc. Nisibis, Mesopotamia, 1952 Burial: c. 170-155 B.C. Contents: 604+ AR Alexander III: late post. tetradr. ( Alex- andreia Troas 1, Assus 3+, Cyme 5, Myrina 5, Temnus 197, Mytilene 4, Chios 2, Alabanda 342, Phaselis 15 to yr. 31, Aspendus 20 to yr. 27, Perge 7 to yr. 28) Side: 3 tetradr. Disposition: New York 69; Copenhagen 18; F. S. Kleiner 9. Photos of a large part of the remainder on file in ANS Seyrig, RN 1963, p. 62,Tr√©sors du Levant (in press) Many pieces ctmk. with anchor, turreted head, or radiate, facing bust of Helios
